cluster_relations.rel_desc: Use of color in branding and design is described as playing a crucial role in overall branding and marketing strategies.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject positively supports, shapes, or enhances the likelihood or quality of the object branding outcome or strategic result.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A distinctive color scheme contributes to creating a strong brand presence.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject positively supports, shapes, or enhances the likelihood or quality of the object branding outcome or strategic result.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject positively supports, enables, or enhances the likelihood, strength, or quality of the object outcome or state.
args.justification: All three relations consistently express a positive causal contribution from a branding-related subject (color usage or color scheme) to a branding outcome (strategy effectiveness, visual identity, or brand presence). The existing canonical_rel_name and class/group are suitable and aligned, but the previous description was overly specific to 'branding outcome or strategic result'. Generalizing the description to any outcome or state makes the predicate reusable across the KG while remaining accurate for these instances.
